text:
Beautifully created floating platform on top of the lake with a closer next-to-water experience on the lake. Has many seats along this platform for resting as well as to catch sunrise and potentially some sunset views.

Good placement in front of Starbucks that you can take a break there if you’re tired or thirsty as well!

Beautiful wetlands surrounded by the lake and greenery. Plenty of space to walk around and enjoy fresh air. The area is easily accessible with a short walking distance from MRT comparing to the rest of lakeside garden. The only downside is the area locates directly under sunshine without shades, so bring sunscreen or umbrella to avoid sunburnt.

Jurong Lake Floating Wetlands is part of the Public Ultilities Board's (PUB) ABC Clean Waters programme. The man-made Floating Wetlands is home to a diversity of water-based flora and fauna. A walkway leads down to the Floating Wetlands where vistors can enjoy the lake's view on water, as well as its wetland habitat.
One particular plant found at the Floating Wetlands is the Sendudok. Interestingly, its seeds is used in the famous "Poh Chai" pills 保济丸 to treat diarrhoea in traditional Chinese Medicine.
Nearer to Boon Lay Way and also Car Park North. There is a Starbuck here as well. You can come much closer to the lake. Can see otter and heron over here. Nice view in the evening.
Very cute bridges connected over the water with relaxing views. Some shaded places to sit and enjoy.
